duck: number theory - Number theory (or arithmetic) is a branch of pure mathematics devoted primarily to the study of the integers.

Biblical numerology - Biblical numerology refers to the interpretation, by some biblical scholars, of numerical values used in the Pentateuch and, consequently, the New Testament that they believe relate to symbolism...
numerology definition: the study of the occult significance of numbers.
Numerology is any study of the purported divine, mystical or other special relationship between a number and some coinciding observed (or perceived) events.
Al-Jamia (scroll) - Al-Jamia is a sacred and secret Shia text, the words of which were dictated by Muhammad to Ali, who then wrote down these words.
Abjad - An abjad is a type of writing system where each symbol always or usually stands for a consonant, leaving the reader to supply the appropriate vowel.
Al-Jafr (book) - Al-Jafr is a mystical Shia holy book compiled, according to Shia belief, by Ali and inherited by him from Muhammad.
Numerology is any study of the purported divine, mystical or other special relationship between a number and some coinciding observed (or perceived) events.

Arithmancy - In modern numerological terminology, arithmancy (a shortened form of Greek ἀριθμομαντεία divination by numbers) is a form of divination based on assigning numerical value to a word or phrase...

wiki.text:
'Numerology' is any study of the purported divine, mystical or other special
relationship between a number and some coinciding observed (or perceived)
events. It has many systems and traditions and beliefs. Numerology and
numerological divination by systems such as isopsephy were popular among early
mathematicians, such as Pythagoras, but are no longer considered part of
mathematics and are regarded as pseudomathematics or pseudoscience by modern
scientists.<ref name="Webb"></ref><ref></ref><ref name=skepdic/>

Today, numerology is often associated with the paranormal, alongside astrology
and similar divinatory arts.<ref></ref>

Despite the long history of numerological ideas, the word "numerology" is not
recorded in English before c.1907.<ref>"numerology, n.". OED Online. September
2012. Oxford University Press.
http://oed.com/view/Entry/129129?redirectedFrom=numerology& (accessed November
23, 2012).</ref>

The term 'numerologist' is also used derogatorily for those perceived to place
excess faith in numerical patterns (and draw scientifically unsound inferences
from them), even if those people do not practice traditional numerology. For
example, in his 1997 book Numerology: Or What Pythagoras Wrought, mathematician
Underwood Dudley uses the term to discuss practitioners of the Elliott wave
principle of stock market analysis.

Some remarks on the purported or commonly perceived numerological
significance of specific numbers may be found at their respective articles,
as at 77 (number).
wiki.title: numerology
